SEARCH

Class Ellipse

java.lang.Object
Shape
Ellipse
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Shape>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Circle
public class Ellipse extends Shape
Concrete definition of an ellipse defined by (in addition to the inherited properties from Shape): a semi-major and semi-minor axis (or radii), which are both of type double.

By definition, a semi-major of an ellipse should always be larger (longer) than the semi-minor axis of the same ellipse.

HINT: area of an ellipse using the semi-major and semi-minor axis can be computed using the formula in: https://www.mathwords.com/a/area_ellipse.htm

  • Constructor Details

    • Ellipse

      public Ellipse(double semiMajorAxis, double semiMinorAxis, Point position, Color color, boolean isFilled)
      Constructs a rectangle with the given width, height, position, color, and isFilled properties.
      Parameters:
      semiMajorAxis - length of the semi-major (longer in relation to sem-minor) axis of the ellipse
      semiMinorAxis - length of the semi-minor (shorter in relation to sem-major) axis of the ellipse
      position - position of the ellipse
      color - Color of the ellipse
      isFilled - true if isFilled, false if only wireframed

      Returns:
      semi-major axis of the ellipse

    • setSemiMajorAxis

      public void setSemiMajorAxis(double newSemiMajorAxis)
      Sets the semi-major axis of this Ellipse object, swapping the major and minor axis if the new quantity given for the semi-major axis ends up being smaller than the existing semi-minor axis.
      Parameters:
      newSemiMajorAxis - new quantity for semi-major axis for the ellipse (possibly to be assigned to semi-minor axis if smaller than the existing semi-minor axis).

    • getSemiMinorAxis

      public double getSemiMinorAxis()
      Retrieves the semi-minor axis of this Ellipse object.
      Returns:
      semi-minor axis of the ellipse

    • setSemiMinorAxis

      public void setSemiMinorAxis(double newSemiMinorAxis)
      Sets the semi-minor axis of this Ellipse object, swapping the minor and major axis if the new quantity given for the semi-minor axis ends up being larger than the existing semi-major axis.
      Parameters:
      newSemiMinorAxis - new quantity for semi-minor axis for the ellipse (possibly to be assigned to semi-major axis if larger than the existing semi-major axis).
